alert.note: Alert for Medina (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 07 at 9:10AM EST until March 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Medina, Summit and Wayne. * WHEN...Until noon EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 910 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Akron, Medina, Cuyahoga Falls, Brunswick, Kent, Barberton, Solon, Hudson, Wadsworth, Twinsburg, Tallmadge, Streetsboro, Macedonia, Rittman, Doylestown, Lodi, Creston, West Salem, Chippewa Lake and Stow. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
